references.paper_title: Neural networks trained with SGD learn distributions of increasing complexity
references.reason: This paper highlights the importance of higher-order cumulants for the performance of neural networks, motivating the current research.

references.paper_title: Neural Tangent Kernel: Convergence and Generalization in Neural Networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the Neural Tangent Kernel, a key concept in understanding the behavior of wide neural networks which is used for comparison in this work.

references.paper_title: On exact computation with an infinitely wide neural net
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical foundations for analyzing infinitely wide neural networks, which are used as a model for comparison in this work.

references.paper_title: A nearly tight sum-of-squares lower bound for the planted clique problem
references.reason: This paper establishes a nearly tight lower bound for the sum-of-squares method, which is relevant to understanding computational complexity in this work.

references.paper_title: Bayesian estimation from few samples: community detection and related problems
references.reason: This paper introduces the low-degree method for analyzing the statistical-computational gap in high-dimensional inference problems, which is a core method used in this work.
